results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Child Abuse and Neglect;Jose Paulino Pascual-Reyes;Dadeville, Ala.
results.title: Girl, 12, Escapes Captivity, Leading Alabama Authorities to Find 2 Bodies
results.abstract: José Paulino Pascual-Reyes, 37, was charged with capital murder and first-degree kidnapping after the authorities said they found two decomposing bodies inside his house.

media.caption: “She’s a hero,” Sheriff Jimmy Abbett of Tallapoosa County, Ala., said of a 12-year-old girl who had managed to escape from captivity. “She’s safe and we want to keep her that way.”

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Presidential Election of 2024;Ethics and Official Misconduct;James, Letitia;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka;Trump, Donald J Jr;Trump Organization
results.byline: By Ben Protess, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Faces Questions About His Net Worth in Interview He Tried to Avoid
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump has embraced the verbal sparring of legal depositions in the past, but now faces significant risk.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump has been deposed many times in a variety of settings, but the stakes of his scheduled session with the New York attorney general’s office are uncommonly high.

results.adx_keywords: Electric Bicycles, Motorcycles and Scooters;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Deaths (Fatalities);Steinsapir, Molly;Rad Power Bikes LLC
results.title: ‘Team Molly’ Parents Sue E-Bike Company Over Daughter’s Death
results.abstract: An online community offered support for Molly Steinsapir, a 12-year-old who experienced brain trauma in an accident last year. Her mother and father have filed suit against Rad Power Bikes.

media.caption: Jonathan and Kaye Steinsapir in the room of their daughter, Molly, who died last year after an e-bike accident.
media.copyright: Adam Perez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Monkeypox;Vaccination and Immunization;California;New York City;Illinois;New York State
results.title: California Declares State of Emergency as Monkeypox Spreads
results.abstract: Three states have now issued emergency declarations in the past week, as have New York City and San Francisco.

media.caption: Long lines for the monkeypox vaccine at San Francisco General Hospital on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;United States Politics and Government;Pelosi, Nancy;House of Representatives;China;Taiwan
results.title: U.S. Warns China Not to Turn Pelosi’s Expected Trip to Taiwan Into a ‘Crisis’
results.abstract: Speaker Nancy Pelosi, a longtime China hawk, has not confirmed that she plans to visit Taiwan, but all indications suggest that she will make a stop on the self-governing island without prior announcement.

results.title: Manchin Won a Pledge From Democrats to Finish a Contested Pipeline
results.abstract: To cement the senator’s support for a climate and tax package, party leaders promised to pass a law to complete the line and to prioritize some other fossil fuel projects.

media.caption: Construction on the Mountain Valley Pipeline, intended to carry natural gas from West Virginia into Virginia, in 2019.

results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi and Michael Levenson
results.title: ‘One miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation’: The U.N. chief issues a grim warning, citing war.
results.abstract: The conflict in Ukraine and tensions over North Korea and Iran have lifted the threat of nuclear disaster to a level not seen since the Cold War.

results.byline: By Paul Mozur, Amy Chang Chien and Michael D. Shear
results.title: As Pelosi touts ‘unwavering’ U.S. commitment to Taiwan, China denounces her visit.
results.abstract: The trip, the highest-level U.S. visit to the island since 1997, came in the face of strenuous objections from Beijing.

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Abortion;States (US);Tennessee;Georgia
results.title: ‘They’re Just Going to Let Me Die?’ One Woman’s Abortion Odyssey
results.abstract: Madison Underwood was thrilled to learn she was pregnant. But when a rare defect in the developing fetus threatened her life, she was thrust into post-Roe chaos.

media.caption: Madison Underwood hugging her mother while her fiancé, Adam Queen, takes a break from the predawn drive across state lines to a Georgia abortion clinic.
media.copyright: Kendrick Brinson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2020;Rumors and Misinformation;Attorneys General;Brnovich, Mark;Republican Party;Arizona
results.title: Arizona Attorney General Debunks Trump Supporters’ Election Fraud Claims
results.abstract: In an inquiry into accusations that dead voters had cast ballots, “many were very surprised to learn they were allegedly deceased,” Mark Brnovich said.

media.caption: The Arizona attorney general, Mark Brnovich, said his office’s Election Integrity Unit had spent “hundreds of hours” investigating hundreds of accusations.
media.copyright: Randy Hoeft/The Yuma Sun, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Inspectors General;Text Messaging;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Cuffari, Joseph V;Thompson, Bennie G;Maloney, Carolyn B;Homeland Security Department;House of Representatives;Secret Service;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.title: Top Democrats, Alleging Cover-Up, Seek Testimony on Secret Service Texts
results.abstract: The leaders of two House committees told the Department of Homeland Security’s inspector general that they had developed “grave new concerns over your lack of transparency and independence.”
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: A letter from Representative Bennie Thompson and the head of another House committee said they had evidence that the inspector general’s office had “secretly abandoned efforts to collect text messages from the Secret Service more than a year ago.”

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: Arizona Officials Warned Fake Electors Plan Could ‘Appear Treasonous’
results.abstract: Politicians involved in Donald Trump’s effort to put forth electors to falsely claim he had won Arizona said doing so without first filing a legal challenge could look like a crime.

media.caption: Kelli Ward, the chairwoman of the Arizona Republican Party, joined an effort to claim former President Donald J. Trump had won the state’s 11 Electoral College votes after expressing concerns.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.title: Trump tries to topple a powerful Wisconsin Republican in his futile quest to reverse his 2020 loss.
results.abstract: The former president endorsed a little-known challenger to Robin Vos, the Republican speaker of the Wisconsin Assembly, who has rejected attempts to overturn the state’s 2020 results.

media.caption: Adam Steen, a little-known challenger to Robin Vos, the speaker of the Wisconsin Assembly, was endorsed by former President Donald J. Trump on Tuesday.
